page.content:
For doing this she was paid Â£10.00 a year, While the Head Teacher was paid Â£55.00 a year. Childrens needle work was sold to raise money. Their lessons were sewing for the girls, gardening for boys. They were also taught together reading, grammer, geography, scripture, history and maths. This is not very different from the lessons that we do today. But the clothes were certainly different. They would have worn sailor suits for the boys and long dresses for the girls. Also today it is not as strict as it would have been in Victorian Times.
